</EFX_UNIDENTIFIED_TABLE>
<P STYLE="MARGIN-TOP:18PX;MARGIN-BOTTOM:0PX">
<FONT STYLE="FONT-FAMILY:TIMES NEW ROMAN" SIZE="2">
<B>
<I>
	Year Ended December&nbsp;31, 2015 Compared to Year Ended December&nbsp;31, 2014
</I>
</B>
</FONT>
</P>
<P STYLE="MARGIN-TOP:6PX;MARGIN-BOTTOM:0PX">
<FONT STYLE="FONT-FAMILY:TIMES NEW ROMAN" SIZE="2">
<I>
	Revenue
</I>
	. Revenue decreased by 26.6% from RMB3,334.4 million in 2014 to RMB2,445.8 million (US$377.6 million) in 2015. The decrease was due to slow
	down in PRC economy and the anticipated change of emission standard that weakened the demand for vehicles.
</FONT>
</P>
<P STYLE="MARGIN-TOP:12PX;MARGIN-BOTTOM:0PX">
<FONT STYLE="FONT-FAMILY:TIMES NEW ROMAN" SIZE="2">
<U>
	PRC aftermarket sales:
</U>
	PRC
	aftermarket sales decreased by 28.3% from RMB1,665.2 million in 2014 to RMB1,194.2 million (US$184.4 million) in 2015. The macro economic conditions of the PRC slowed down significantly in 2015. A reduction in construction and infrastructure related
	activities lead to a significant decline in demand for aftermarket wheels.
</FONT>
</P>
<P STYLE="MARGIN-TOP:0PX;MARGIN-BOTTOM:0PX">
<FONT SIZE="1">
	&nbsp;
</FONT>
</P>
<P STYLE="MARGIN-TOP:0PX;MARGIN-BOTTOM:0PX" ALIGN="CENTER">
<FONT STYLE="FONT-FAMILY:TIMES NEW ROMAN" SIZE="2">
	64
</FONT>
</P>
<A NAME="eolPage67"></A>
<P STYLE='PAGE-BREAK-BEFORE:ALWAYS'>
<HR SIZE="3" STYLE="COLOR:#999999" WIDTH="100%" ALIGN="CENTER">
<H5 ALIGN="LEFT">
<A HREF="#D156239D20F_HTM_TOC">
	Table of Contents
</A>
</H5>
<P STYLE="MARGIN-TOP:0PX;MARGIN-BOTTOM:0PX">
<FONT STYLE="FONT-FAMILY:TIMES NEW ROMAN" SIZE="2">
<U>
	PRC OEM sales:
</U>
	PRC OEM sales decreased by 29.4% from RMB1,153.6 million in 2014 to RMB814.6 million
	(US$125.8 million) in 2015. The slowdown in the macroeconomic conditions of the PRC resulted in a reduction in construction and infrastructure related activities which, in turn, lead to a significant decline in truck sales, especially in the medium-
	to heavy-duty truck sectors. PRC truck sale is estimated to have decreased by approximately 27.0% in 2015 compared to 2014. We proactively lowered our prices in the first three quarters of 2015 to maintain our market shares but began to raise our
	prices again in the fourth quarter, the historical high season.
</FONT>
</P>
<P STYLE="MARGIN-TOP:12PX;MARGIN-BOTTOM:0PX">
<FONT STYLE="FONT-FAMILY:TIMES NEW ROMAN" SIZE="2">
<U>
	International sales:
</U>
	International sales decreased by 15.3% from
	RMB515.6 million in 2014 to RMB436.9 million (US$67.5 million) in 2015. We continued to open new markets such as Dubai and Pakistan in 2015. However, in early 2015, despite a higher unit sales, our international sales decreased as a result of the
	Renminbi depreciation and competitive pricing. In the second half of 2015, the slowdown of China also resulted in sufficient uncertainty on the world market and the developing countries in particular. The resulting currency depreciation in
	Southeastern Asian countries, including Thailand, Indonesia and Burma, weakened the demand for our products from these markets.
</FONT>
</P>
<P STYLE="MARGIN-TOP:12PX;MARGIN-BOTTOM:0PX">
<FONT STYLE="FONT-FAMILY:TIMES NEW ROMAN" SIZE="2">
	Average
	selling prices of tubed and tubeless steel wheels sold in the PRC and internationally decreased from 2014 to 2015 mainly due to PRC market slow down and increased competition.
</FONT>
</P>
<P STYLE="MARGIN-TOP:12PX;MARGIN-BOTTOM:0PX">
<FONT STYLE="FONT-FAMILY:TIMES NEW ROMAN" SIZE="2">
<I>
	Cost of Sales
</I>
	. Cost of sales decreased by 24.2% from RMB2,744.9 million in 2014 to RMB2,082.0 million (US$321.4 million) in 2015. The decrease was primarily due to a RMB558.1 million (US$86.2
	million) decrease in raw material costs, mainly as a result of decreased sales volume and a small decrease in the price of steel, our principal raw material, during the period. As a percentage of revenue, cost of sales increased from 82.3% in 2014
	to 85.1% in 2015.
</FONT>
</P>
<P STYLE="MARGIN-TOP:12PX;MARGIN-BOTTOM:0PX">
<FONT STYLE="FONT-FAMILY:TIMES NEW ROMAN" SIZE="2">
<I>
	Gross Profit
</I>
	. As a result of the foregoing factors, gross profit decreased by 38.3% from RMB589.5 million in 2014 to
	RMB363.8 million (US$56.2 million) in 2015, and gross profit margin decreased from 17.7% in 2014 to 14.9% in 2015.
</FONT>
</P>
<P STYLE="MARGIN-TOP:12PX;MARGIN-BOTTOM:0PX">
<FONT STYLE="FONT-FAMILY:TIMES NEW ROMAN" SIZE="2">
	Our gross profit margin
	decreased by 2.8% from 2014 to 2015 primarily due to (i)&nbsp;while there was a decrease in sales volume, depreciation and certain other fixed overhead costs remained, (ii)&nbsp;while we adjusted the salary and other compensations of our employees,
	the decrease in sales volume outpaced the decreases in salary and compensations, and (iii)&nbsp;we proactively lowered our prices in the first three quarters of 2015 to maintain our market shares, the decrease in our sale price outpaced the
	decreases in raw material costs.
</FONT>
</P>
<P STYLE="MARGIN-TOP:12PX;MARGIN-BOTTOM:0PX">
<FONT STYLE="FONT-FAMILY:TIMES NEW ROMAN" SIZE="2">
	Our fourth quarter gross profit margin was 19.2%, higher than our gross profit margin for the year of 14.9%,
	primarily due to (i)&nbsp;raising our prices in the fourth quarter, the traditional high season for our sales, (ii)&nbsp;the prices of raw materials continued to decrease in the fourth quarter, and (iii)&nbsp;we began commercial production of
	aluminum wheels, which enjoys a much higher profit margin than other steel products.
</FONT>
</P>
<P STYLE="MARGIN-TOP:12PX;MARGIN-BOTTOM:0PX">
<FONT STYLE="FONT-FAMILY:TIMES NEW ROMAN" SIZE="2">
<I>
	Other Income, Gain and Loss
</I>
	. Other income, gain
	and loss decreased by 36.3% from a gain of RMB25.8 million in 2014 to a gain of RMB16.4 million (US$2.5 million) in 2015. The decrease in gain was primarily due to (i)&nbsp;a RMB5.0 million (US$0.8 million) decrease in government grants, (ii)&nbsp;a
	RMB3.5 million (US$0.5 million) decrease in interest income, and (iii)&nbsp;a RMB0.9 million (US$0.1 million) increase of net loss from sales of scrap materials in 2015 compared to 2014.
</FONT>
</P>
<P STYLE="MARGIN-TOP:12PX;MARGIN-BOTTOM:0PX">
<FONT STYLE="FONT-FAMILY:TIMES NEW ROMAN" SIZE="2">
<I>
	Net Exchange Gains (Losses)
</I>
	. We had net exchange gains of RMB5.8 million (US$0.9 million) in 2015 due to the depreciation of Renminbi in 2015, when we collected on certain U.S. dollar denominated
	accounts receivable, as compared to a gain of RMB1.7 million in 2014.
</FONT>
</P>
<P STYLE="MARGIN-TOP:12PX;MARGIN-BOTTOM:0PX">
<FONT STYLE="FONT-FAMILY:TIMES NEW ROMAN" SIZE="2">
<I>
	Selling and Distribution Costs
</I>
	. Selling and distribution costs
	decreased by 16.4% from RMB253.8 million in 2014 to RMB212.3 million (US$32.8 million) in 2015. The decrease was primarily due to (i)&nbsp;a RMB31.7 million (US$4.9 million) decrease in transportation and export costs, in line with our decrease in
	sales volume, (ii)&nbsp;a RMB3.2 million (US$0.5 million) decrease in business promotion and advertising expenses and subsidies in line with a decrease in our promotional activities, (iii)&nbsp;a RMB2.6 million (US$0.4 million decrease in warranty
	compensation paid to our distributors, and (iv)&nbsp;a RMB2.5 million (US$0.4 million) decrease in salaries, bonuses and related expenses. As a percentage of revenue, selling and distribution costs increased from 7.6% in 2014 to 8.7% in 2015.
</FONT>
</P>
<P STYLE="MARGIN-TOP:12PX;MARGIN-BOTTOM:0PX">
<FONT STYLE="FONT-FAMILY:TIMES NEW ROMAN" SIZE="2">
<I>
	Research and Development Expenses
</I>
	. Research and development expenses decreased by 47.7% from RMB98.0 million in 2014 to RMB51.3
	million (US$7.9 million) in 2015. The decrease was primarily due to a RMB38.8 million (US$6.0 million) decrease in raw material costs. As a percentage of revenue, research and development expenses increased from 2.9% in 2014 to 2.1% in 2015.
</FONT>
</P>
<P STYLE="MARGIN-TOP:0PX;MARGIN-BOTTOM:0PX">
<FONT SIZE="1">
	&nbsp;
</FONT>
</P>
<P STYLE="MARGIN-TOP:0PX;MARGIN-BOTTOM:0PX" ALIGN="CENTER">
<FONT STYLE="FONT-FAMILY:TIMES NEW ROMAN" SIZE="2">
	65
</FONT>
</P>
<A NAME="eolPage68"></A>
<P STYLE='PAGE-BREAK-BEFORE:ALWAYS'>
<HR SIZE="3" STYLE="COLOR:#999999" WIDTH="100%" ALIGN="CENTER">
<H5 ALIGN="LEFT">
<A HREF="#D156239D20F_HTM_TOC">
	Table of Contents
</A>
</H5>
<P STYLE="MARGIN-TOP:0PX;MARGIN-BOTTOM:0PX">
<FONT STYLE="FONT-FAMILY:TIMES NEW ROMAN" SIZE="2">
<I>
	Administrative Expenses
</I>
	. Administrative expenses decreased by 8.6% from RMB149.5 million in 2014 to
	RMB136.7 million (US$21.1 million) in 2015. The decrease was primarily due to (i)&nbsp;a RMB8.8 million (US$1.4 million) decrease in salaries, bonuses and related expenses, (ii)&nbsp;a RMB3.4 million (US$0.5 million ) decrease in consulting fees;
	partially offset by a RMB3.8 million (US$0.6 million) increase in depreciation expenses. As a percentage of revenue, administrative expenses increased from 4.5% in 2014 to 5.6% in 2015.
</FONT>
</P>
<P STYLE="MARGIN-TOP:12PX;MARGIN-BOTTOM:0PX">
<FONT STYLE="FONT-FAMILY:TIMES NEW ROMAN" SIZE="2">
<I>
	Finance Costs
</I>
	. Finance costs decreased by 9.6% from RMB17.6 million in 2014 to RMB15.9 million (US$2.5 million) in 2015. The decrease was primarily due to loan balances decreased in 2015.
</FONT>
</P>
<P STYLE="MARGIN-TOP:12PX;MARGIN-BOTTOM:0PX">
<FONT STYLE="FONT-FAMILY:TIMES NEW ROMAN" SIZE="2">
<I>
	Income Tax (Expense) Credit
</I>
	. Income tax expense decreased by 108.4% from an expense of RMB18.7 million in 2014 to a credit of RMB1.6
	million (US$0.2 million) in 2015. The decrease was primarily due to a decrease in our profit before taxation.
</FONT>
</P>
<P STYLE="MARGIN-TOP:12PX;MARGIN-BOTTOM:0PX">
<FONT STYLE="FONT-FAMILY:TIMES NEW ROMAN" SIZE="2">
<I>
	Profit (loss) for the
	Year
</I>
	. As a result of the foregoing factors, profit for the year decreased from a profit of RMB79.2 million and a net profit margin of 2.4% in 2014 to a loss of RMB28.6 million (US$4.4 million) and a net loss margin of 1.2% in 2015.
</FONT>
</P>
<P STYLE="MARGIN-TOP:18PX;MARGIN-BOTTOM:0PX">
<FONT STYLE="FONT-FAMILY:TIMES NEW ROMAN" SIZE="2">
<B>
<I>
	Year Ended December&nbsp;31, 2014 Compared to Year Ended December&nbsp;31, 2013
</I>
</B>
</FONT>
</P>
<P STYLE="MARGIN-TOP:6PX;MARGIN-BOTTOM:0PX">
<FONT STYLE="FONT-FAMILY:TIMES NEW ROMAN" SIZE="2">
<I>
	Revenue
</I>
	. Revenue decreased by 12.3% from RMB3,802.3 million in 2013 to RMB3,334.4 million (US$537.4 million) in 2014. The decrease was due to slow down in PRC economy and the anticipated change of
	emission standard that weakened the demand for vehicles.
</FONT>
</P>
<P STYLE="MARGIN-TOP:12PX;MARGIN-BOTTOM:0PX">
<FONT STYLE="FONT-FAMILY:TIMES NEW ROMAN" SIZE="2">
<U>
	PRC aftermarket sales:
</U>
	PRC aftermarket sales decreased by 13.6% from
	RMB1,928.2 million in 2013 to RMB1,665.2 million (US$268.4 million) in 2014, primarily due to (i)&nbsp;a decrease in the sales volume of both tubed steel wheels and tubeless steel wheels and (ii)&nbsp;reduced average selling prices. The decrease in
	sales volume primarily resulted from reduced construction and infrastructure related project as the growth of PRC economy slowed down in the second half of 2014.
</FONT>
</P>
<P STYLE="MARGIN-TOP:12PX;MARGIN-BOTTOM:0PX">
<FONT STYLE="FONT-FAMILY:TIMES NEW ROMAN" SIZE="2">
<U>
	PRC OEM sales:
</U>
	PRC OEM sales decreased by 12.4% from RMB1,316.8 million in 2013 to RMB1,153.6 million (US$185.9 million) in 2014, primarily due to (i)&nbsp;a decrease in the sales volume of tubed
	steel wheels, and (ii)&nbsp;reduced average selling prices. The decrease in sales volume of tubed steel wheels primarily resulted from an expected implementation of PRC National IV emission standard that weakened the demand of current model of
	National III emission standard vehicles. As a result, wheel sales decreased as truck manufacturers cut back on new vehicle production in order to streamline inventory.
</FONT>
</P>
<P STYLE="MARGIN-TOP:12PX;MARGIN-BOTTOM:0PX">
<FONT STYLE="FONT-FAMILY:TIMES NEW ROMAN" SIZE="2">
<U>
	International sales:
</U>
	International sales decreased by 7.5% from RMB557.3 million in 2013 to RMB515.6 million (US$83.1 million) in 2014. Due to a recessive Indian market and an increase in the
	anti-dumping duties imposed by the Indian government in India, we have nearly ceased our sales to the Indian market. However, we had also achieved significant gain in the Southeast Asian market, our total units sold as international sales only
	decreased by 1.5%.
</FONT>
</P>
<P STYLE="MARGIN-TOP:12PX;MARGIN-BOTTOM:0PX">
<FONT STYLE="FONT-FAMILY:TIMES NEW ROMAN" SIZE="2">
	Average selling prices of tubed and tubeless steel wheels sold in the PRC and internationally decreased from 2013 to 2014
	mainly due to PRC market slow down and increased competition.
</FONT>
</P>
<P STYLE="MARGIN-TOP:12PX;MARGIN-BOTTOM:0PX">
<FONT STYLE="FONT-FAMILY:TIMES NEW ROMAN" SIZE="2">
<I>
	Cost of Sales
</I>
	. Cost of sales decreased by 8.9% from RMB3,011.6 million
	in 2013 to RMB2,744.9 million (US$442.4 million) in 2014. The decrease was primarily due to a RMB234.8 million (US$37.8 million) decrease in raw material costs, mainly as a result of decreased sales volume and a small decrease in the price of steel,
	our principal raw material, during the period. As a percentage of revenue, cost of sales increased from 79.2% in 2013 to 82.3% in 2014.
</FONT>
</P>
<P STYLE="MARGIN-TOP:12PX;MARGIN-BOTTOM:0PX">
<FONT STYLE="FONT-FAMILY:TIMES NEW ROMAN" SIZE="2">
<I>
	Gross Profit
</I>
	. As a result of the foregoing factors, gross profit decreased by 25.4% from RMB790.7 million in 2013 to RMB589.5 million (US$95.0
	million) in 2014, and gross profit margin decreased from 20.8% in 2013 to 17.7% in 2014.
</FONT>
</P>
<P STYLE="MARGIN-TOP:12PX;MARGIN-BOTTOM:0PX">
<FONT STYLE="FONT-FAMILY:TIMES NEW ROMAN" SIZE="2">
<I>
	Other Income, Gain and Loss
</I>
	. Other income,
	gain and loss decreased by 5.6% from a gain of RMB27.3 million in 2013 to a gain of RMB25.8 million (US$4.2 million) in 2014. The decrease in gain was primarily due to a RMB6.5 million (US$1.0 million) decrease in government grants; partially offset
	by (i)&nbsp;a RMB2.3 million (US$0.4 million) decrease in losses from sales of scrap materials in 2014 compared to 2013 and an increase in interest income of RMB2.9 million (US$0.5 million).
</FONT>
</P>
<P STYLE="MARGIN-TOP:12PX;MARGIN-BOTTOM:0PX">
<FONT STYLE="FONT-FAMILY:TIMES NEW ROMAN" SIZE="2">
<I>
	Net Exchange Gains (Losses)
</I>
	. We had net exchange gains of RMB1.7 million (US$0.3 million) in 2014 due to the depreciation of Renminbi in the first two quarters of 2014, when we collected on certain
	U.S. dollar denominated accounts receivable, as compared to an exchange losses of RMB7.4 million in 2013.
</FONT>
</P>
<P STYLE="MARGIN-TOP:0PX;MARGIN-BOTTOM:0PX">
<FONT SIZE="1">
	&nbsp;
</FONT>
</P>
<P STYLE="MARGIN-TOP:0PX;MARGIN-BOTTOM:0PX" ALIGN="CENTER">
<FONT STYLE="FONT-FAMILY:TIMES NEW ROMAN" SIZE="2">
	66
</FONT>
</P>
<A NAME="eolPage69"></A>
<P STYLE='PAGE-BREAK-BEFORE:ALWAYS'>
<HR SIZE="3" STYLE="COLOR:#999999" WIDTH="100%" ALIGN="CENTER">
<H5 ALIGN="LEFT">
<A HREF="#D156239D20F_HTM_TOC">
	Table of Contents
</A>
</H5>
<P STYLE="MARGIN-TOP:0PX;MARGIN-BOTTOM:0PX">
<FONT STYLE="FONT-FAMILY:TIMES NEW ROMAN" SIZE="2">
<I>
	Selling and Distribution Costs
</I>
	. Selling and distribution costs decreased by 7.6% from RMB274.8
	million in 2013 to RMB253.8 million (US$40.9 million) in 2014. The decrease was primarily due to (i)&nbsp;a RMB16.6 million (US$2.7 million) decrease in transportation and export costs, in line with our decrease in sales volume, and (ii)&nbsp;a
	RMB2.6 million (US$0.4 million) decrease in business promotion and advertising expenses and subsidies in line with a decrease in our promotional activities. As a percentage of revenue, selling and distribution costs increased from 7.2% in 2013 to
	7.6% in 2014.
</FONT>
</P>
<P STYLE="MARGIN-TOP:12PX;MARGIN-BOTTOM:0PX">
<FONT STYLE="FONT-FAMILY:TIMES NEW ROMAN" SIZE="2">
<I>
	Research and Development Expenses
</I>
	. Research and development expenses increased by 7.0% from RMB91.6 million in 2013 to
	RMB98.0 million (US$15.8 million) in 2014. The increase was primarily due to a RMB2.3 million (US$0.4 million) increase in raw material costs and RMB3.3 million (US$0.5 million) consumed in research and development activities. As a percentage of
	revenue, research and development expenses increased from 2.4% in 2013 to 2.9% in 2014.
</FONT>
</P>
<P STYLE="MARGIN-TOP:12PX;MARGIN-BOTTOM:0PX">
<FONT STYLE="FONT-FAMILY:TIMES NEW ROMAN" SIZE="2">
<I>
	Administrative Expenses
</I>
	. Administrative
	expenses increased by 4.9% from RMB142.5 million in 2013 to RMB149.5 million (US$24.1 million) in 2014. The increase was primarily due to (i)&nbsp;a RMB9.2 million (US$1.5 million) increase in salaries, bonuses and related expenses, including
	compensation for our special committee to evaluate certain acquisition proposal, and for the salaries we paid for the increase in the number of our administrative personnel and management in connection with preparation of our planned aluminum wheel
	manufacturing facility under Hua&#146;anZhengxing Wheel Co., Ltd., (ii)&nbsp;a RMB1.7 million (US$0.3 million ) in consulting fees for the same acquisition proposal; partially offset by a RMB2.1 million (US$0.3 million) decrease in auditing
	expenses. As a percentage of revenue, administrative expenses increased from 3.7% in 2013 to 4.5% in 2014.
</FONT>
</P>
<P STYLE="MARGIN-TOP:12PX;MARGIN-BOTTOM:0PX">
<FONT STYLE="FONT-FAMILY:TIMES NEW ROMAN" SIZE="2">
<I>
	Finance Costs
</I>
	. Finance
	costs decreased by 32.3% from RMB26.0 million in 2013 to RMB17.6 million (US$2.8 million) in 2014. The decrease was primarily due to a decrease in the amount borrowed and interest rate on bank borrowings, as well as the capitalization of interest
	expense in the current year.
</FONT>
</P>
<P STYLE="MARGIN-TOP:12PX;MARGIN-BOTTOM:0PX">
<FONT STYLE="FONT-FAMILY:TIMES NEW ROMAN" SIZE="2">
<I>
	Income Tax Expense
</I>
	. Income tax expense decreased by 56.4% from RMB42.9 million in 2013 to RMB18.7 million
	(US$3.0 million) in 2014. The decrease was primarily due to a decrease in our profit before taxation. Our effective tax rate increased from 15.6% in 2013 to 19.1% in 2014.
</FONT>
</P>
<P STYLE="MARGIN-TOP:12PX;MARGIN-BOTTOM:0PX">
<FONT STYLE="FONT-FAMILY:TIMES NEW ROMAN" SIZE="2">
<I>
	Profit for the Year
</I>
	. As a result of the foregoing factors, profit for the year decreased by 65.9% from RMB232.7 million in 2013 to RMB79.2 million (US$12.8 million) in 2014, and net profit margin
	decreased from 6.1% in 2013 to 2.4% in 2014.
</FONT>
</P>
</EFX_RESULTS_OF_OPERATIONS>
<P STYLE="FONT-SIZE:18PX;MARGIN-TOP:0PX;MARGIN-BOTTOM:0PX">
	&nbsp;
</P>
<EFX_LIQUIDITY_CAPITAL>
<A NAME="FIS_LIQUIDITY_CAPITAL"></A>
<TABLE STYLE="BORDER-COLLAPSE:COLLAPSE" BORDER="0" CELLPADDING="0" CELLSPACING="0" WIDTH="100%">
<TR>
<TD WIDTH="4%" VALIGN="TOP" ALIGN="LEFT">
<FONT STYLE="FONT-FAMILY:TIMES NEW ROMAN" SIZE="2">
<B>
	B.
</B>
</FONT>
</TD>
<TD ALIGN="LEFT" VALIGN="TOP">
<FONT STYLE="FONT-FAMILY:TIMES NEW ROMAN" SIZE="2">
<B>
	LIQUIDITY AND CAPITAL RESOURCES
</B>
</FONT>
</TD>
</TR>
</TABLE>
<P STYLE="MARGIN-TOP:6PX;MARGIN-BOTTOM:0PX">
<FONT STYLE="FONT-FAMILY:TIMES NEW ROMAN" SIZE="2">
<B>
	Liquidity and Capital Resources
</B>
</FONT>
</P>
<P STYLE="MARGIN-TOP:6PX;MARGIN-BOTTOM:0PX">
<FONT STYLE="FONT-FAMILY:TIMES NEW ROMAN" SIZE="2">
	To date,
	we have financed our operations primarily through cash flow from operations, bank borrowings, equity contributions by our shareholders and net proceeds from our initial public offering on May&nbsp;17, 2011. As of December&nbsp;31, 2015, we had
	RMB817.2 million (US$126.2 million) in cash and cash equivalents. Our cash and cash equivalents consist primarily of cash on hand and bank balances.
</FONT>
</P>
<P STYLE="MARGIN-TOP:12PX;MARGIN-BOTTOM:0PX">
<FONT STYLE="FONT-FAMILY:TIMES NEW ROMAN" SIZE="2">
	We had net current assets of RMB660.2&nbsp;million, RMB736.4 million and RMB732.9 (US$113.1 million) as of December&nbsp;31, 2013, 2014 and 2015, respectively. We believe that our current levels of cash
	and cash flows from operations, combined with funds available to us through financing and the net proceeds from our initial public offering, will be sufficient to meet our anticipated cash needs for at least the next 12 months. However, we may need
	additional cash resources in the future if we experience changed business conditions or other developments or if we wish to pursue opportunities for investment, acquisition, strategic cooperation or other similar actions. If we determine that our
	cash requirements exceed our cash on hand, we may seek to issue debt or equity securities or obtain a credit facility. Any issuance of equity or equity-linked securities could dilute our shareholders. Any incurrence of indebtedness could increase
	our debt service obligations and cause us to be subject to restrictive operating and finance covenants. It is possible that, when we need additional cash resources, financing will only be available to us in amounts or on terms that would not be
	acceptable to us or financing will not be available at all.
</FONT>
</P>
<P STYLE="MARGIN-TOP:12PX;MARGIN-BOTTOM:0PX">
<FONT STYLE="FONT-FAMILY:TIMES NEW ROMAN" SIZE="2">
	Our bank borrowings were primarily obtained from two PRC banks for the purposes
	of general working capital and funding of capital expenditure needs. As of December&nbsp;31, 2013, 2014 and 2015, our total bank borrowings amounted to RMB558.0 million, RMB508.0 million and RMB558.0 million (US$86.1 million). We did not have any
	non-current borrowing. We do not have any variable-rate borrowings as of December&nbsp;31, 2013, 2014 and 2015. In 2013, 2014 and 2015, our fixed-rate bank borrowings carried interest rates ranging from 6.0% to 6.6%, 5.6% to 6.0%&nbsp;and 4.35% to
	5.6%&nbsp;per annum, respectively.
</FONT>
</P>
<P STYLE="MARGIN-TOP:0PX;MARGIN-BOTTOM:0PX">
<FONT SIZE="1">
	&nbsp;
</FONT>
</P>
<P STYLE="MARGIN-TOP:0PX;MARGIN-BOTTOM:0PX" ALIGN="CENTER">
<FONT STYLE="FONT-FAMILY:TIMES NEW ROMAN" SIZE="2">
	67
</FONT>
</P>
<A NAME="eolPage70"></A>
<P STYLE='PAGE-BREAK-BEFORE:ALWAYS'>
<HR SIZE="3" STYLE="COLOR:#999999" WIDTH="100%" ALIGN="CENTER">
<H5 ALIGN="LEFT">
<A HREF="#D156239D20F_HTM_TOC">
	Table of Contents
</A>
</H5>
<P STYLE="MARGIN-TOP:0PX;MARGIN-BOTTOM:0PX">
<FONT STYLE="FONT-FAMILY:TIMES NEW ROMAN" SIZE="2">
	A portion of our bank borrowings were secured. As of December&nbsp;31, 2013, bank borrowings amounting to
	RMB180.0 million were secured by pledged bank deposits, property, plant and equipment and prepaid lease payments, and the remaining bank borrowings of RMB378.0 million were unsecured. As of December&nbsp;31, 2014, bank borrowings amounting to
	RMB130.0 million were secured by pledged bank deposits, property, plant and equipment and prepaid lease payments, and the remaining bank borrowings of RMB378.0 million were unsecured. As of December&nbsp;31, 2015, bank borrowings amounting to RMB180
	million (US$27.8 million) were secured by pledged bank deposits, property, plant and equipment and prepaid lease payments, and the remaining bank borrowings of RMB378.0 million (US$58.4 million) were unsecured.
</FONT>
</P>

<FONT STYLE="FONT-FAMILY:TIMES NEW ROMAN" SIZE="2">

<P STYLE="MARGIN-TOP:12PX;MARGIN-BOTTOM:0PX">
<FONT STYLE="FONT-FAMILY:TIMES NEW ROMAN" SIZE="2">
	In addition, certain of our bank borrowings were guaranteed by our subsidiaries, namely ZhengxingLangfang Wheel,
	Zhengxing Chengdu Wheel, Zhengxing Hefei Wheel and Zhengxing Benxi Wheel, pursuant to three guarantee agreements entered into in January 2008 and 2009. As of December&nbsp;31, 2013, 2014 and 2015, these guaranteed bank borrowings amounted to
	RMB558.0 million, RMB508.0 million and RMB558.0 million (US$86.1 million), respectively.
</FONT>
</P>
<P STYLE="MARGIN-TOP:12PX;MARGIN-BOTTOM:0PX">
<FONT STYLE="FONT-FAMILY:TIMES NEW ROMAN" SIZE="2">
	We plan to repay these bank borrowings with cash
	generated from our operating activities in the event we are unable to obtain extensions of these facilities or alternative funding in the future. As of December&nbsp;31, 2013, 2014 and 2015, we had available undrawn one-year borrowing facilities
	from two PRC banks of RMB1,176.0 million, RMB1,401.0 million and RMB1,660 million (US$256.3 million), respectively. We have historically been able to repay our bank borrowings when they become due. We expect to be able to obtain additional bank
	borrowings should we need additional funding for working capital and capital expenditures.
</FONT>
</P>

<FONT STYLE="FONT-FAMILY:TIMES NEW ROMAN" SIZE="2">
<I>
	Operating Activities
</I>
</FONT>
</P>
<P STYLE="MARGIN-TOP:6PX;MARGIN-BOTTOM:0PX">
<FONT STYLE="FONT-FAMILY:TIMES NEW ROMAN" SIZE="2">
	We derive cash inflow from operations primarily through the receipt of payments for the sales of our products. Our cash outflow from operations is used primarily for raw material purchases, staff costs
	and miscellaneous expenses used in operating activities. Our net cash from operating activities reflects our profit for the year, as adjusted for non-cash items such as depreciation and amortization, and the effects of changes in working capital
	such as increases or decreases in trade and other receivables and prepayments and trade and other payables and accruals, and increases or decreases in inventories.
</FONT>
</P>
<P STYLE="MARGIN-TOP:0PX;MARGIN-BOTTOM:0PX">
<FONT SIZE="1">
	&nbsp;
</FONT>
</P>
<P STYLE="MARGIN-TOP:0PX;MARGIN-BOTTOM:0PX" ALIGN="CENTER">
<FONT STYLE="FONT-FAMILY:TIMES NEW ROMAN" SIZE="2">
	68
</FONT>
</P>
<A NAME="eolPage71"></A>
<P STYLE='PAGE-BREAK-BEFORE:ALWAYS'>
<HR SIZE="3" STYLE="COLOR:#999999" WIDTH="100%" ALIGN="CENTER">
<H5 ALIGN="LEFT">
<A HREF="#D156239D20F_HTM_TOC">
	Table of Contents
</A>
</H5>
<P STYLE="MARGIN-TOP:0PX;MARGIN-BOTTOM:0PX">
<FONT STYLE="FONT-FAMILY:TIMES NEW ROMAN" SIZE="2">
	Net cash from operating activities was RMB293.8 million (US$45.4 million) in 2015, which was primarily
	attributable to (i)&nbsp;a decrease in trade and other receivables and prepayments of RMB306.0 million (US$47.2 million) primarily due to reduced sales and lower prepayment to raw material suppliers, (ii)&nbsp;decrease in inventory of RMB200.2
	million (US$30.9 million), and (iii)&nbsp;deprecation of property, plant and equipment of RMB131.3 million (US$20.3 million); partially offset by a decrease in trade and other payables and accruals of RMB335.7 million (US$51.8 million) primarily due
	to decreased sales in 2015.
</FONT>
</P>
<P STYLE="MARGIN-TOP:12PX;MARGIN-BOTTOM:0PX">
<FONT STYLE="FONT-FAMILY:TIMES NEW ROMAN" SIZE="2">
	Net cash from operating activities was RMB101.6 million in 2014, which was primarily attributable to
	(i)&nbsp;profit before taxation of RMB97.9 million (US$15.8 million); (ii)&nbsp;depreciation of property, plant and equipment of RMB128.8 million, (iii)&nbsp;a decrease in trade and other receivables and prepayments of RMB56.5 million primarily due
	to decreased sales in 2014; partially offset by a decrease in trade and other payables and accruals of RMB184.9 million primarily due to decreased sales in 2014.
</FONT>
</P>
<P STYLE="MARGIN-TOP:12PX;MARGIN-BOTTOM:0PX">
<FONT STYLE="FONT-FAMILY:TIMES NEW ROMAN" SIZE="2">
	Net cash from operating activities was RMB282.4 million in 2013, which was primarily attributable to (i)&nbsp;profit before taxation of RMB275.6 million; (ii)&nbsp;depreciation of property, plant and
	equipment of RMB126.0 million; (iii)&nbsp;an increase in trade and other payables and accruals of RMB78.4 million, primarily due to increased sales in 2013 and (iv)&nbsp;finance costs of RMB26.0 million; partially offset by (A)&nbsp;an increase in
	trade and other receivables and prepayments of RMB160.0 million primarily due to increased sales in 2013 and (B)&nbsp;PRC income tax paid of RMB43.2 million.
</FONT>
</P>
<P STYLE="MARGIN-TOP:18PX;MARGIN-BOTTOM:0PX">
<FONT STYLE="FONT-FAMILY:TIMES NEW ROMAN" SIZE="2">
<I>
	Investing Activities
</I>
</FONT>
</P>
<P STYLE="MARGIN-TOP:6PX;MARGIN-BOTTOM:0PX">
<FONT STYLE="FONT-FAMILY:TIMES NEW ROMAN" SIZE="2">
	Net cash used in investing activities was RMB59.6 million (US$9.2
	million) in 2015, which was primarily attributable to (i)&nbsp;placement of fixed bank deposits with maturity periods over three months of RMB520.0 million (US$80.3 million), (ii)&nbsp;deposit paid for acquisition of property, plant and equipment of
	RMB70.1 million (US$10.8 million), (iii)&nbsp;purchase of property, plant and equipment of RMB20.5 million (US$3.2 million) in connection with the expansion of our manufacturing facilities in Chengdu, Sichuan Province and the construction of a new
	aluminum wheel manufacturing facility, and (iv)&nbsp;placement of pledged bank deposits of RMB2.9 million (US$0.4 million); partially offset by (A)&nbsp;withdrawal of fixed bank deposits with maturity periods over three months of RMB520.0 million
	(US$80.3 million) and (B)&nbsp;withdrawal of pledged bank deposits of RMB33.8 million (US$5.2 million).
</FONT>
</P>
<P STYLE="MARGIN-TOP:12PX;MARGIN-BOTTOM:0PX">
<FONT STYLE="FONT-FAMILY:TIMES NEW ROMAN" SIZE="2">
	Net cash used in investing activities
	was RMB215.8 million in 2014, which was primarily attributable to (i)&nbsp;placement of fixed bank deposits with maturity periods over three months of RMB420.0 million, (ii)&nbsp;deposit paid for acquisition of property, plant and equipment of
	RMB85.6 million, (iii)&nbsp;purchase of property, plant and equipment of RMB47.9 million in connection with the expansion of our manufacturing facilities in Chengdu, Sichuan Province and the construction of a new aluminum wheel manufacturing
	facility, and (iv)&nbsp;placement of pledged bank deposits of RMB9.5 million; partially offset by (A)&nbsp;withdrawal of fixed bank deposits with maturity periods over three months of RMB320.0 million and (B)&nbsp;withdrawal of pledged bank deposits
	of RMB27.0 million (US$4.4 million).
</FONT>
</P>
<P STYLE="MARGIN-TOP:12PX;MARGIN-BOTTOM:0PX">
<FONT STYLE="FONT-FAMILY:TIMES NEW ROMAN" SIZE="2">
	Net cash used in investing activities was RMB181.0 million in 2013, which was primarily attributable to
	(i)&nbsp;deposit paid for acquisition of property, plant and equipment of RMB112.8 million, (ii)&nbsp;purchase of property, plant and equipment of RMB62.7 million in connection with the expansion of our manufacturing facilities in Chengdu, Sichuan
	Province and the construction of a new aluminum wheel manufacturing facility, and (iii)&nbsp;placement of pledged bank deposits of RMB11.5 million.
</FONT>
</P>
<P STYLE="MARGIN-TOP:18PX;MARGIN-BOTTOM:0PX">
<FONT STYLE="FONT-FAMILY:TIMES NEW ROMAN" SIZE="2">
<I>
	Financing Activities
</I>
</FONT>
</P>
<P STYLE="MARGIN-TOP:6PX;MARGIN-BOTTOM:0PX">
<FONT STYLE="FONT-FAMILY:TIMES NEW ROMAN" SIZE="2">
	Net cash from financing activities was RMB24.7 million (US$3.8
	million) in 2015, which was attributable to (i)&nbsp;new bank borrowings raised of RMB558.0 million (US$86.1 million), and (ii)&nbsp;advance from related parties of RMB6.2 million (US$1.0 million); partially offset by (i)&nbsp;repayment of bank
	borrowings of RMB508.0 million (US$78.4) million, and (ii)&nbsp;interest paid of RMB31.5 million (US$4.9 million).
</FONT>
</P>
<P STYLE="MARGIN-TOP:12PX;MARGIN-BOTTOM:0PX">
<FONT STYLE="FONT-FAMILY:TIMES NEW ROMAN" SIZE="2">
	Net cash used in financing
	activities was RMB77.4 million in 2014, which was attributable to (i)&nbsp;repayment of bank borrowings of RMB558.0 million, and (ii)&nbsp;interest paid of RMB32.9 million; partially offset by new bank borrowings raised of RMB508.0 million.
</FONT>
</P>
<P STYLE="MARGIN-TOP:12PX;MARGIN-BOTTOM:0PX">
<FONT STYLE="FONT-FAMILY:TIMES NEW ROMAN" SIZE="2">
	Net cash used in financing activities was RMB181.2 million in 2013, which was attributable to (i)&nbsp;repayment of bank borrowings of
	RMB700.0 million and (ii)&nbsp;interest paid of RMB39.2 million, partially offset by new bank borrowings raised of RMB558.0 million.
</FONT>
</P>
<P STYLE="MARGIN-TOP:0PX;MARGIN-BOTTOM:0PX">
<FONT SIZE="1">
	&nbsp;
</FONT>

<FONT STYLE="FONT-FAMILY:TIMES NEW ROMAN" SIZE="2">
	We do not
	engage in trading activities involving non-exchange traded contracts or interest rate swap transactions or foreign currency forward contracts. In the ordinary course of our business, we do not enter into transactions involving, or otherwise form
	relationships with, unconsolidated entities or financial partnerships that are established for the purpose of facilitating off-balance sheet arrangements or other contractually narrow or limited purposes.

<EFX_NAME_AND_TITLE>
<A NAME="FIS_NAME_AND_TITLE"></A>
<TABLE STYLE="BORDER-COLLAPSE:COLLAPSE" BORDER="0" CELLPADDING="0" CELLSPACING="0" WIDTH="100%">
<TR>
<TD WIDTH="4%" VALIGN="TOP" ALIGN="LEFT">
<FONT STYLE="FONT-FAMILY:TIMES NEW ROMAN" SIZE="2">
<B>
	A.
</B>
</FONT>
</TD>
<TD ALIGN="LEFT" VALIGN="TOP">
<FONT STYLE="FONT-FAMILY:TIMES NEW ROMAN" SIZE="2">
<B>
	Directors and Senior Management
</B>
</FONT>
</TD>

</TABLE>
<P STYLE="MARGIN-TOP:6PX;MARGIN-BOTTOM:0PX">
<FONT STYLE="FONT-FAMILY:TIMES NEW ROMAN" SIZE="2">
	The
	following table sets forth information regarding our directors and executive officers as of March&nbsp;31, 2016:
</FONT>
</P>
<P STYLE="FONT-SIZE:12PX;MARGIN-TOP:0PX;MARGIN-BOTTOM:0PX">
	&nbsp;
</P>
<TABLE CELLSPACING="0" CELLPADDING="0" WIDTH="100%" BORDER="0" STYLE="BORDER-COLLAPSE:COLLAPSE" ALIGN="CENTER">
<TR>
<TD WIDTH="18%">
</TD>
<TD VALIGN="BOTTOM" WIDTH="2%">
</TD>
<TD>
</TD>
<TD>
</TD>
<TD>
</TD>
<TD VALIGN="BOTTOM" WIDTH="2%">
</TD>
<TD WIDTH="77%">
</TD>
</TR>
<TR>
<TD VALIGN="BOTTOM" NOWRAP>
<P STYLE="BORDER-BOTTOM:1PX SOLID #000000;WIDTH:20PT">
<FONT STYLE="FONT-FAMILY:TIMES NEW ROMAN" SIZE="1">
<B>
	Name
</B>
</FONT>
</P>
</TD>
<TD VALIGN="BOTTOM">
<FONT SIZE="1">
	&nbsp;&nbsp;
</FONT>
</TD>

	&nbsp;

<P STYLE="MARGIN-TOP:0PX;MARGIN-BOTTOM:0PX" ALIGN="CENTER">
<FONT STYLE="FONT-FAMILY:TIMES NEW ROMAN" SIZE="2">
	70
</FONT>
</P>
<A NAME="eolPage73"></A>
<P STYLE='PAGE-BREAK-BEFORE:ALWAYS'>
<HR SIZE="3" STYLE="COLOR:#999999" WIDTH="100%" ALIGN="CENTER">
<H5 ALIGN="LEFT">
<A HREF="#D156239D20F_HTM_TOC">
	Table of Contents
</A>
</H5>
<P STYLE="MARGIN-TOP:0PX;MARGIN-BOTTOM:0PX">
<FONT STYLE="FONT-FAMILY:TIMES NEW ROMAN" SIZE="2">
	The business address of our directors and executive officers is c/o No.&nbsp;1608, North Circle Road State
	Highway, Zhangzhou, Fujian Province 363000, People&#146;s Republic of China.
</FONT>
</P>
<P STYLE="MARGIN-TOP:12PX;MARGIN-BOTTOM:0PX">
<FONT STYLE="FONT-FAMILY:TIMES NEW ROMAN" SIZE="2">
<I>
	Mr.&nbsp;Jianhui Lai
</I>
	is our founder, chairman of our
	board of directors and chief executive officer. Mr.&nbsp;Lai has over 20 years of experience in the commercial vehicle wheel industry in the PRC, particularly in managing vehicle wheel businesses. Prior to founding us in 2003, Mr.&nbsp;Lai was
	factory manager of Zhangzhou XiangchengZhengxing Automobile Wheel Factory from 1996 to 2003, factory manager of Fujian PingheGuanxi Automobile Wheel Factory from 1993 to 1996, and factory manager of Pinghe Automobile Tire and Bicycle Repair Depot
	from 1988 to 1993. Mr.&nbsp;Lai was awarded The Outstanding Private Entrepreneur in the PRC in 2004 and The Outstanding Individual of the PRC Automotive Industry in 2008, in recognition of his business achievements and stature in the industry.
	Mr.&nbsp;Lai is also the founder of two schools (providing primary school to high school education) in the PRC, namely PingheZhengxing School and Zhangzhou Zhengxing School.
</FONT>
</P>
<P STYLE="MARGIN-TOP:12PX;MARGIN-BOTTOM:0PX">
<FONT STYLE="FONT-FAMILY:TIMES NEW ROMAN" SIZE="2">
<I>
	Mr.&nbsp;Junqiu Gao
</I>
	has served as our director since February 2009, and as our deputy chief executive officer and chief sales and marketing officer since June 2008. Mr.&nbsp;Gao also served as our
	marketing and sales manager from 2004 to 2008. Mr.&nbsp;Gao has over 20 years of marketing and sales and management experience in the commercial vehicle wheel and machinery industry in the PRC. Prior to joining us in 2004, Mr.&nbsp;Gao was head of
	the marketing and sales department of Zhangzhou XiangchengZhengxing Automobile Wheel Factory from 1999 to 2004 and was a regional product sales manager of Xuzhou Press System Company Limited from 1993 to 1999. Mr.&nbsp;Gao also served as an
	electrical design technician and product after-sales engineer of Xuzhou Press System Company Limited from 1990 to 1993. Mr.&nbsp;Gao is a senior engineer and received his bachelor&#146;s degree in industrial electrical automation from Hefei
	University of Technology in 1990.
</FONT>
</P>
<P STYLE="MARGIN-TOP:12PX;MARGIN-BOTTOM:0PX">
<FONT STYLE="FONT-FAMILY:TIMES NEW ROMAN" SIZE="2">
<I>
	Mr.&nbsp;William John Sharp
</I>
	has served as our independent director since May 2011. Mr.&nbsp;Sharp
	has over 40 years of experience in the tire manufacturing industry. Since 2001, Mr.&nbsp;Sharp has served as president of Global Industrial Consulting, a consulting firm. Since 2005, Mr.&nbsp;Sharp has been a director of Xingda International
	Holdings Limited, a Hong Kong Stock Exchange listed company which manufactures components for radial tires where he serves as chairman of the compensation committee and a member of the audit committee. Since 2008, Mr.&nbsp;Sharp has been a director
	of Acquity Group LLC, a multi-channel commerce and digital marketing company where he serves as a member of the audit and compensation committees. From 1998 to 2012, Mr.&nbsp;Sharp was a director of Ferro Corporation, a New York Stock Exchange
	listed company that produces performance materials where he served as a member of the compensation committee. From 2009 to February 2012, Mr.&nbsp;Sharp was a director of Exceed Co. Ltd., a NASDAQ listed company that produces footwear, apparel and
	accessories where he served as chairman of the audit committee and the compensation committee. Mr.&nbsp;Sharp joined The Goodyear Tire&nbsp;&amp; Rubber Company in 1964 and was the president of its North America Tire group from 1999 to 2000. Prior
	to that, he was the president of its Global Support Operations from 1996 to 1999, and the president of Goodyear Europe, Middle East and Africa from 1992 to 1996. Mr.&nbsp;Sharp received his bachelor of science degree in industrial engineering from
	Ohio State University in 1963.
</FONT>
</P>
<P STYLE="MARGIN-TOP:12PX;MARGIN-BOTTOM:0PX">
<FONT STYLE="FONT-FAMILY:TIMES NEW ROMAN" SIZE="2">
<I>
	Mr.&nbsp;Xiandai Zhang
</I>
	has served as our independent director since November 2014. Mr.&nbsp;Zhang is
	the director of taxation and a legal representative of Quanzhou Fangzheng Taxation since 2005. From 2000 to 2005, Mr.&nbsp;Zhang was the deputy director and an accountant at Quanzhou Fangzheng Accounting. Previously, he was the deputy director and
	accountant in the City of Shishi and an auditor in Yong&#146;An City. Mr.&nbsp;Zhang is a Certified Public Accountant and Chartered Tax Adviser in China. He is also qualified as an economist and senior auditor. Mr.&nbsp;Zhang has over 20 years of
	experience in auditing, tax and accounting including 6 years of national auditing, 16 years experience with accounting and tax firms, and 12 years as an auditor or tax project manager. Mr.&nbsp;Zhang received his bachelor&#146;s degree in accounting
	from Fuzhou University in 1992.
</FONT>
</P>
<P STYLE="MARGIN-TOP:12PX;MARGIN-BOTTOM:0PX">
<FONT STYLE="FONT-FAMILY:TIMES NEW ROMAN" SIZE="2">
<I>
	Mr.&nbsp;Yichun Zhang
</I>
	has served as our independent director since May 2011. Mr.&nbsp;Zhang is the
	head of the Financial Research Institute of Xiamen University. Since 1960, Mr.&nbsp;Zhang has been a lecturer of the economics department, associate professor and deputy head of the finance and fiscal department of the economics faculty, professor,
	supervisor of doctoral candidates and department head of the finance and fiscal department, professor, supervisor of doctoral candidates and faculty head of the economics faculty, and professor, supervisor of doctoral candidates and head of the
	fiscal research institute, all of Xiamen University. In addition, Mr.&nbsp;Zhang has served as an independent director of CNFOL.COM Company Limited, a PRC online financial information provider, Shanghai CiFi Company Limited, a PRC property
	developer, and Shenzhen Minsheng Royal Fund Management Co., Ltd., a PRC fund management company (where he serves as a member of the audit committee), since 2007. Mr.&nbsp;Zhang also served as an independent director of Zhengzhou Gas Company Limited,
	a Hong Kong Stock Exchange listed company, from 2002 to 2008, and Fujian Zhonghe Company Limited, a Shenzhen Stock Exchange listed company, from 2002 to 2008. Mr.&nbsp;Zhang served as an external supervisor of Industrial Bank Company Limited, a
	Shanghai Stock Exchange listed company, from 2004 to 2007. Mr.&nbsp;Zhang received his bachelor&#146;s degree in economics from Xiamen University in 1960.
</FONT>
</P>
<P STYLE="MARGIN-TOP:0PX;MARGIN-BOTTOM:0PX">
<FONT SIZE="1">
	&nbsp;
</FONT>
</P>
<P STYLE="MARGIN-TOP:0PX;MARGIN-BOTTOM:0PX" ALIGN="CENTER">
<FONT STYLE="FONT-FAMILY:TIMES NEW ROMAN" SIZE="2">
	71
</FONT>
</P>

<P STYLE='PAGE-BREAK-BEFORE:ALWAYS'>
<HR SIZE="3" STYLE="COLOR:#999999" WIDTH="100%" ALIGN="CENTER">
<H5 ALIGN="LEFT">
<A HREF="#D156239D20F_HTM_TOC">
	Table of Contents
</A>
</H5>
<P STYLE="MARGIN-TOP:0PX;MARGIN-BOTTOM:0PX">
<FONT STYLE="FONT-FAMILY:TIMES NEW ROMAN" SIZE="2">
<I>
	Mr.&nbsp;Martin Cheung
</I>
	has over 13 years of experience in accounting and finance with publicly and
	privately held companies. Mr.&nbsp;Cheung was most recently Chief Financial Officer of Profound Heavy Company Limited, and he has been Finance Director of Norstar Founders Group Limited (2339: HK), recently renamed Beijing West Industry
	International, and he was the Corporate Finance Director at Grant Thornton Corporate Finance Limited. Additionally, Mr.&nbsp;Cheung held management positions at Japan Asia Securities and Daiwa Securities. Mr Cheung currently is an independent
	director of Boyaa International Ltd., (434.HK)&nbsp;and Co-Prosperity Holdings Limtied (707.HK). Mr.&nbsp;Cheung was a senior auditor at Deloitte Touche Tohmatsu. Mr.&nbsp;Cheung is a Certified Public Accountant, with a master&#146;s degree in
	Accounting from Curtin University of Technology (Australia), a master&#146;s of Science degree in Finance (Investment Management) from the Hong Kong University of Science and Technology, and a bachelor&#146;s degree in Social Sciences from the
	University of Hong Kong.
</FONT>
</P>
<P STYLE="MARGIN-TOP:12PX;MARGIN-BOTTOM:0PX">
<FONT STYLE="FONT-FAMILY:TIMES NEW ROMAN" SIZE="2">
<I>
	Mr.&nbsp;Xichuan Lai
</I>
	has served as our financial controller since August 2006. Mr.&nbsp;Lai also served as
	our financial manager from 2004 to 2006. Mr.&nbsp;Lai has over 18 years of finance experience. Prior to joining us in 2004, Mr.&nbsp;Lai served as manager of the finance department of Fujian Motor Industry Group Company from 1999 to 2004.
	Mr.&nbsp;Lai also served as an accountant of Fujian Automobile Factory from 1992 to 1999. Mr.&nbsp;Lai is a senior accountant and received his bachelor&#146;s degree in auditing from Fuzhou University in 1992.
</FONT>
</P>
<P STYLE="MARGIN-TOP:12PX;MARGIN-BOTTOM:0PX">
<FONT STYLE="FONT-FAMILY:TIMES NEW ROMAN" SIZE="2">
<I>
	Mr.&nbsp;Guohe Zhang
</I>
	has served as our chief technology officer since 2003. Mr.&nbsp;Zhang has over 40 years of research and production technology
	management experience in the commercial vehicle wheel and machinery industry in the PRC. Prior to joining us in 2003, Mr.&nbsp;Zhang was the deputy chief engineer and the director of the wheel research institution of Zhenjiang Jinhuan Group Co.,
	Ltd. from 1981 to 2003. Mr.&nbsp;Zhang received the Jiangsu New Product Development Golden Bull Award in 1990, in recognition of his achievements in research and development. Mr.&nbsp;Zhang is a senior engineer and received his bachelor&#146;s
	degree in mechanical design and manufacturing from Jiangsu University in 1970.
</FONT>
</P>
<P STYLE="MARGIN-TOP:12PX;MARGIN-BOTTOM:0PX">
<FONT STYLE="FONT-FAMILY:TIMES NEW ROMAN" SIZE="2">
<I>
	Mr.&nbsp;Jiangjun Yang
</I>
	has served as our chief
	production officer since January 2007. Mr.&nbsp;Yang also served as our production manager from 2005 to 2006 and our head of production line from 2003 to 2005. Mr.&nbsp;Yang has over 12 years of production and management experience in the commercial
	vehicle wheel industry in the PRC. Prior to joining us in 2003, Mr.&nbsp;Yang worked at Zhangzhou XiangchengZhengxing Automobile Wheel Factory from 1998 to 2003. Mr.&nbsp;Yang completed his junior college study in administrative management at Xiamen
	University in 2001.
</FONT>
</P>
<P STYLE="FONT-SIZE:18PX;MARGIN-TOP:0PX;MARGIN-BOTTOM:0PX">
	&nbsp;
</P>

<TR>
<TD WIDTH="4%" VALIGN="TOP" ALIGN="LEFT">
<FONT STYLE="FONT-FAMILY:TIMES NEW ROMAN" SIZE="2">
<B>
	B.
</B>
</FONT>
</TD>
<TD ALIGN="LEFT" VALIGN="TOP">
<FONT STYLE="FONT-FAMILY:TIMES NEW ROMAN" SIZE="2">
<B>
	Compensation
</B>
</FONT>
</TD>
</TR>
</TABLE>
<P STYLE="MARGIN-TOP:6PX;MARGIN-BOTTOM:0PX">
<FONT STYLE="FONT-FAMILY:TIMES NEW ROMAN" SIZE="2">
<B>
	Terms of Directors and
	Executive Officers
</B>
</FONT>
</P>
<P STYLE="MARGIN-TOP:6PX;MARGIN-BOTTOM:0PX">
<FONT STYLE="FONT-FAMILY:TIMES NEW ROMAN" SIZE="2">
	Our executive officers are elected by and serve at the discretion of our board of directors. Our directors may be
	subject to a term of office if fixed by the resolution of shareholders or the resolution of directors, as the case may be, appointing them. At our annual general meeting of shareholders, our shareholders are asked to elect the directors nominated to
	serve for the ensuing year and until their successors are elected and duly qualified, or until such director&#146;s earlier death, bankruptcy, insanity, resignation or removal. Our directors may resign from their office by giving written notice to
	us. Our directors may be removed from office, with or without cause, by a resolution of shareholders. For information regarding the period during which our officers and directors have served in their respective positions, please refer to
	Item&nbsp;6A. &#147;Directors and Senior Management.&#148;
</FONT>
</P>
<P STYLE="MARGIN-TOP:0PX;MARGIN-BOTTOM:0PX">
<FONT SIZE="1">
	&nbsp;
</FONT>
</P>
<P STYLE="MARGIN-TOP:0PX;MARGIN-BOTTOM:0PX" ALIGN="CENTER">
<FONT STYLE="FONT-FAMILY:TIMES NEW ROMAN" SIZE="2">
	72
</FONT>
</P>
<A NAME="eolPage75"></A>
<P STYLE='PAGE-BREAK-BEFORE:ALWAYS'>
<HR SIZE="3" STYLE="COLOR:#999999" WIDTH="100%" ALIGN="CENTER">
<H5 ALIGN="LEFT">
<A HREF="#D156239D20F_HTM_TOC">
	Table of Contents
</A>
</H5>
<P STYLE="MARGIN-TOP:0PX;MARGIN-BOTTOM:0PX">
<FONT STYLE="FONT-FAMILY:TIMES NEW ROMAN" SIZE="2">
<B>
	Employment and Indemnification Agreements
</B>
</FONT>
</P>
<P STYLE="MARGIN-TOP:6PX;MARGIN-BOTTOM:0PX">
<FONT STYLE="FONT-FAMILY:TIMES NEW ROMAN" SIZE="2">
	We have entered into employment agreements with each of our executive officers. Under these agreements, each of our executive officers is employed for a specified time period. We may terminate employment
	(i)&nbsp;with cause effective immediately upon delivery of written notice to the executive officer or (ii)&nbsp;without cause by giving the executive a three months&#146; prior written notice. Termination for cause may occur for the continued
	failure by an executive officer substantially to perform his duties and obligations to us, fraud or material dishonesty against us, or a conviction or plea of guilty for the commission of a felony or other crime. In the event of the termination by
	us without cause, we agree to pay the executive officer certain compensation for a certain period following the date of termination. The executive officer may also voluntarily terminate his employment with us upon not less than three months&#146;
	prior written notice to us.
</FONT>
</P>
<P STYLE="MARGIN-TOP:12PX;MARGIN-BOTTOM:0PX">
<FONT STYLE="FONT-FAMILY:TIMES NEW ROMAN" SIZE="2">
	Each executive officer has agreed, for the term of employment with us and thereafter, to keep and retain in the
	strictest confidence all our confidential information that the executive may develop or learn in the course of employment with us. Our executive officers also agree to assign to us all right, title and interest in and to all patents, trademarks,
	copyrights, business secrets, operation secrets or know-how, which they may solely or jointly conceive, discover, develop or reduce to practice during the period of employment. Moreover, each of our executive officers has agreed, for the term of
	employment with us and for a period of six months or one year thereafter, (i)&nbsp;to not engage in any business in competition with our business, (ii)&nbsp;to not solicit any entity that has been our customer within two years before termination of
	employment or our potential customer within one year before termination of employment and (iii)&nbsp;to not solicit for employment, hire or otherwise engage anyone who has been our employee, member or partner within the previous year.
</FONT>
</P>
<P STYLE="MARGIN-TOP:12PX;MARGIN-BOTTOM:0PX">
<FONT STYLE="FONT-FAMILY:TIMES NEW ROMAN" SIZE="2">
	We have entered into indemnification agreements with our directors and executive officers to indemnify them to the fullest extent permitted by applicable
	law and our memorandum and articles of association, from and against all costs, charges, expenses, liabilities and losses incurred in connection with any litigation, suit or proceeding to which such director or executive officer is or is threatened
	to be made a party, witness or other participant.
</FONT>
</P>
<P STYLE="MARGIN-TOP:18PX;MARGIN-BOTTOM:0PX">
<FONT STYLE="FONT-FAMILY:TIMES NEW ROMAN" SIZE="2">
<B>
	Compensation of Directors and Executive Officers
</B>
</FONT>
</P>
<P STYLE="MARGIN-TOP:6PX;MARGIN-BOTTOM:0PX">
<FONT STYLE="FONT-FAMILY:TIMES NEW ROMAN" SIZE="2">
	In 2015, the aggregate cash compensation, including basic salary and bonus and other benefits, to all of our directors and our executive officers was
	RMB4.1 million (US$0.6 million). On March&nbsp;30, 2012, we also granted restricted share unit awards to each of our independent directors which vested on March&nbsp;25, 2013. ADSs, representing less than 1% of our total outstanding ordinary shares,
	were given to the directors in settlement of such awards upon vesting. We have not set aside or accrued any amount to provide pension, retirement or other similar benefits to our executive officers and directors. Our PRC subsidiaries are required by
	law to make contributions equal to certain percentages of each employee&#146;s salary for his or her pension insurance, medical insurance, housing fund, employment and other statutory benefits.
</FONT>
</P>
<P STYLE="MARGIN-TOP:18PX;MARGIN-BOTTOM:0PX">
<FONT STYLE="FONT-FAMILY:TIMES NEW ROMAN" SIZE="2">
<B>
	2011 Share Incentive Plan
</B>
</FONT>
</P>
<P STYLE="MARGIN-TOP:6PX;MARGIN-BOTTOM:0PX">
<FONT STYLE="FONT-FAMILY:TIMES NEW ROMAN" SIZE="2">
	Our board of
	directors and shareholders approved and adopted our 2011 Share Incentive Plan in February 2011. Under the 2011 Share Incentive Plan, a total of 25,000,000 ordinary shares have been reserved for issuance. A general description of the terms of the
	2011 Share Incentive Plan is set forth below:
</FONT>
</P>
<P STYLE="MARGIN-TOP:18PX;MARGIN-BOTTOM:0PX">
<FONT STYLE="FONT-FAMILY:TIMES NEW ROMAN" SIZE="2">
<B>
<I>
	Purpose of the Plan
</I>
</B>
</FONT>
</P>
<P STYLE="MARGIN-TOP:6PX;MARGIN-BOTTOM:0PX">
<FONT STYLE="FONT-FAMILY:TIMES NEW ROMAN" SIZE="2">
	The purpose of the 2011 Share Incentive Plan is to attract and retain the best available personnel, to provide additional incentive to employees, directors and consultants and to promote the success of
	our business.
</FONT>
</P>
<P STYLE="MARGIN-TOP:18PX;MARGIN-BOTTOM:0PX">
<FONT STYLE="FONT-FAMILY:TIMES NEW ROMAN" SIZE="2">
<B>
<I>
	Eligibility
</I>
</B>
</FONT>
</P>
<P STYLE="MARGIN-TOP:6PX;MARGIN-BOTTOM:0PX">
<FONT STYLE="FONT-FAMILY:TIMES NEW ROMAN" SIZE="2">
	Under the 2011 Share Incentive Plan, awards may be granted to employees, directors or consultants of our company, our subsidiaries or our parent corporation (as defined therein).
</FONT>
</P>
<P STYLE="MARGIN-TOP:0PX;MARGIN-BOTTOM:0PX">
<FONT SIZE="1">
	&nbsp;
</FONT>
</P>
<P STYLE="MARGIN-TOP:0PX;MARGIN-BOTTOM:0PX" ALIGN="CENTER">
<FONT STYLE="FONT-FAMILY:TIMES NEW ROMAN" SIZE="2">
	73
</FONT>
</P>

<I>
	Types of Awards
</I>
</B>
</FONT>
</P>
<P STYLE="MARGIN-TOP:6PX;MARGIN-BOTTOM:0PX">
<FONT STYLE="FONT-FAMILY:TIMES NEW ROMAN" SIZE="2">
	Awards that can be granted under the 2011 Share Incentive Plan include, among others:
</FONT>
</P>
<P STYLE="FONT-SIZE:6PX;MARGIN-TOP:0PX;MARGIN-BOTTOM:0PX">
	&nbsp;

<P STYLE="MARGIN-TOP:12PX;MARGIN-BOTTOM:0PX">
<FONT STYLE="FONT-FAMILY:TIMES NEW ROMAN" SIZE="2">
	Under the 2011 Share Incentive Plan, we may also grant incentive stock options, or ISOs, within the meaning of the U.S. Internal Revenue Code of 1986, as
	amended, to employees who are located in the United States or who are U.S. taxpayers.
</FONT>
</P>
<P STYLE="MARGIN-TOP:18PX;MARGIN-BOTTOM:0PX">
<FONT STYLE="FONT-FAMILY:TIMES NEW ROMAN" SIZE="2">
<B>
<I>
	Plan Administration
</I>
</B>
</FONT>
</P>
<P STYLE="MARGIN-TOP:6PX;MARGIN-BOTTOM:0PX">
<FONT STYLE="FONT-FAMILY:TIMES NEW ROMAN" SIZE="2">
	Our board of directors designated our compensation committee to administer the 2011 Share Incentive Plan. References in this subsection to our board of
	directors include our compensation committee designated by our board of directors to administer the 2011 Share Incentive Plan.
</FONT>
</P>
<P STYLE="MARGIN-TOP:18PX;MARGIN-BOTTOM:0PX">
<FONT STYLE="FONT-FAMILY:TIMES NEW ROMAN" SIZE="2">
<B>
<I>
	Awards
</I>
</B>
</FONT>
</P>
<P STYLE="MARGIN-TOP:6PX;MARGIN-BOTTOM:0PX">
<FONT STYLE="FONT-FAMILY:TIMES NEW ROMAN" SIZE="2">
	Awards granted under the 2011 Share Incentive Plan are evidenced by award agreements that set forth the terms, conditions and
	limitations for each award.
</FONT>
</P>
<P STYLE="MARGIN-TOP:18PX;MARGIN-BOTTOM:0PX">
<FONT STYLE="FONT-FAMILY:TIMES NEW ROMAN" SIZE="2">
<B>
<I>
	Acceleration of Awards upon Corporate Transactions or Change in Control
</I>
</B>
</FONT>
</P>
<P STYLE="MARGIN-TOP:6PX;MARGIN-BOTTOM:0PX">
<FONT STYLE="FONT-FAMILY:TIMES NEW ROMAN" SIZE="2">
	The 2011 Share Incentive Plan provides for acceleration of awards upon the occurrence of specified corporate transactions or changes in control. Our board
	of directors will have the authority, exercisable either in advance of any actual or anticipated corporate transaction or change in control or at the time of an actual corporate transaction or change in control and exercisable at the time of the
	grant of an award under the 2011 Share Incentive Plan or any time while an award remains outstanding, to provide for the full or partial automatic vesting and exercisability of one or more outstanding unvested awards under the 2011 Share Incentive
	Plan and the release from restrictions on transfer and repurchase or forfeiture rights of such awards in connection with a corporate transaction or change in control, on such terms and conditions as our board of directors may specify. Our board of
	directors also will have the authority to condition any such award vesting and exercisability or release from such limitations upon the subsequent termination of the continuous service of the grantee within a specified period following the effective
	date of the corporate transaction or change in control. Our board of directors may provide that any awards so vested or released from such limitations in connection with a change in control, shall remain fully exercisable until the expiration or
	sooner termination of the award.
</FONT>
</P>
<P STYLE="MARGIN-TOP:18PX;MARGIN-BOTTOM:0PX">
<FONT STYLE="FONT-FAMILY:TIMES NEW ROMAN" SIZE="2">
<B>
<I>
	Exercise or Purchase Price and Term of Awards
</I>
</B>
</FONT>
</P>
<P STYLE="MARGIN-TOP:6PX;MARGIN-BOTTOM:0PX">
<FONT STYLE="FONT-FAMILY:TIMES NEW ROMAN" SIZE="2">
	Our board of directors determines the exercise price, purchase price, expiration date, vesting schedule and other terms and conditions of each grant of
	award.
</FONT>
</P>
<P STYLE="MARGIN-TOP:18PX;MARGIN-BOTTOM:0PX">
<FONT STYLE="FONT-FAMILY:TIMES NEW ROMAN" SIZE="2">
<B>
<I>
	Transferability
</I>
</B>
</FONT>
</P>
<P STYLE="MARGIN-TOP:6PX;MARGIN-BOTTOM:0PX">
<FONT STYLE="FONT-FAMILY:TIMES NEW ROMAN" SIZE="2">
	Under the 2011 Share Incentive Plan, ISOs may not be sold, pledged, assigned, hypothecated, transferred or disposed of in any manner other than by will or
	by the laws of descent or distribution and may be exercised during the lifetime of the grantee only by the grantee. Other awards shall be transferable (i)&nbsp;by will and by the laws of descent and distribution and (ii)&nbsp;during the lifetime of
	the grantee, to the extent and in the manner authorized by our board of directors. The 2011 Share Incentive Plan permits the designation of beneficiaries by holders of awards, including ISOs.
</FONT>
</P>
<P STYLE="MARGIN-TOP:18PX;MARGIN-BOTTOM:0PX">
<FONT STYLE="FONT-FAMILY:TIMES NEW ROMAN" SIZE="2">
<B>
<I>
	Termination of Service
</I>
</B>
</FONT>
</P>
<P STYLE="MARGIN-TOP:6PX;MARGIN-BOTTOM:0PX">
<FONT STYLE="FONT-FAMILY:TIMES NEW ROMAN" SIZE="2">
	The period following the termination of a grantee&#146;s
	employment or service with us during which the grantee can exercise his or her option, if any, will be specified in the award agreement, and it cannot end later than the last day of the specified period or the last day of the original term of the
	award. Any restricted shares and restricted share units that are at the time of termination subject to restrictions will generally be forfeited and automatically transferred to and reacquired by us at no cost to us, unless otherwise specified in the
	applicable award agreement.
</FONT>
</P>
<P STYLE="MARGIN-TOP:0PX;MARGIN-BOTTOM:0PX">
<FONT SIZE="1">
	&nbsp;
</FONT>
</P>
<P STYLE="MARGIN-TOP:0PX;MARGIN-BOTTOM:0PX" ALIGN="CENTER">
<FONT STYLE="FONT-FAMILY:TIMES NEW ROMAN" SIZE="2">
	74
</FONT>
</P>

	Table of Contents

</H5>
<P STYLE="MARGIN-TOP:0PX;MARGIN-BOTTOM:0PX">
<FONT STYLE="FONT-FAMILY:TIMES NEW ROMAN" SIZE="2">
<B>
<I>
	Amendment or Termination of the 2011 Share Incentive Plan
</I>
</B>
</FONT>
</P>
<P STYLE="MARGIN-TOP:6PX;MARGIN-BOTTOM:0PX">
<FONT STYLE="FONT-FAMILY:TIMES NEW ROMAN" SIZE="2">
	Under the 2011 Share Incentive Plan, our board of directors may at any time amend, suspend, or terminate the 2011 Share Incentive Plan in any respect,
	except that no amendment will be effective without shareholder approval if such approval is required to comply with any law, regulation or stock exchange rule or our memorandum and articles of association and no suspension or termination may
	adversely affect any award previously granted. Unless terminated earlier, the 2011 Share Incentive Plan will terminate automatically in 2021.
</FONT>
</P>
<P STYLE="FONT-SIZE:18PX;MARGIN-TOP:0PX;MARGIN-BOTTOM:0PX">
	&nbsp;
</P>
<TABLE STYLE="BORDER-COLLAPSE:COLLAPSE" BORDER="0" CELLPADDING="0" CELLSPACING="0" WIDTH="100%">
<TR>
<TD WIDTH="4%" VALIGN="TOP" ALIGN="LEFT">
<FONT STYLE="FONT-FAMILY:TIMES NEW ROMAN" SIZE="2">
<B>
	C.
</B>
</FONT>
</TD>
<TD ALIGN="LEFT" VALIGN="TOP">
<FONT STYLE="FONT-FAMILY:TIMES NEW ROMAN" SIZE="2">
<B>
	Board Practices
</B>
</FONT>
</TD>
</TR>
</TABLE>
<P STYLE="MARGIN-TOP:6PX;MARGIN-BOTTOM:0PX">
<FONT STYLE="FONT-FAMILY:TIMES NEW ROMAN" SIZE="2">
<B>
	Duties of Directors
</B>
</FONT>
</P>
<P STYLE="MARGIN-TOP:6PX;MARGIN-BOTTOM:0PX">
<FONT STYLE="FONT-FAMILY:TIMES NEW ROMAN" SIZE="2">
	Under British Virgin Islands law, our directors have a fiduciary duty to act honestly, in good faith and in what the director believes to
	be in our best interests. Our directors also have a duty to exercise the care, diligence and skill that a reasonable director would exercise in the same circumstances taking into account, without limitation: (a)&nbsp;the nature of the company,
	(b)&nbsp;the nature of the decision, and (c)&nbsp;the position of the director and the nature of the responsibilities undertaken by him. In fulfilling their duty of care to us, our directors must ensure compliance with our memorandum and articles of
	association and the BVI Act.
</FONT>
</P>
<P STYLE="MARGIN-TOP:12PX;MARGIN-BOTTOM:0PX">
<FONT STYLE="FONT-FAMILY:TIMES NEW ROMAN" SIZE="2">
	The functions and powers of our board of directors include, among others:
</FONT>
</P>
<P STYLE="FONT-SIZE:6PX;MARGIN-TOP:0PX;MARGIN-BOTTOM:0PX">
	&nbsp;
</P>
<TABLE STYLE="BORDER-COLLAPSE:COLLAPSE" BORDER="0" CELLPADDING="0" CELLSPACING="0" WIDTH="100%">

	&#149;

<FONT SIZE="1">
	&nbsp;
</FONT>
</TD>
<TD ALIGN="LEFT" VALIGN="TOP">

<FONT STYLE="FONT-FAMILY:TIMES NEW ROMAN" SIZE="2">
	convening shareholders&#146; general meetings and reporting its work to shareholders at such meetings;
</FONT>
</P>
</TD>
</TR>
</TABLE>
<P STYLE="FONT-SIZE:6PX;MARGIN-TOP:0PX;MARGIN-BOTTOM:0PX">
	&nbsp;

	issuing authorized but unissued shares and redeeming or purchasing outstanding shares of our company;
</FONT>
</P>

<P STYLE="FONT-SIZE:6PX;MARGIN-TOP:0PX;MARGIN-BOTTOM:0PX">
	&nbsp;

	&nbsp;

</FONT>

<P ALIGN="LEFT">
<FONT STYLE="FONT-FAMILY:TIMES NEW ROMAN" SIZE="2">
	approving the transfer of shares of our company, including the registering of such shares in our share register.
</FONT>
</P>
</TD>
</TR>
</TABLE>
<P STYLE="MARGIN-TOP:18PX;MARGIN-BOTTOM:0PX">
<FONT STYLE="FONT-FAMILY:TIMES NEW ROMAN" SIZE="2">
<B>
	Committee of the Board of Directors
</B>
</FONT>
</P>
<P STYLE="MARGIN-TOP:6PX;MARGIN-BOTTOM:0PX">
<FONT STYLE="FONT-FAMILY:TIMES NEW ROMAN" SIZE="2">
	We
	have established three committees under the board of directors: the audit committee, the compensation committee and the nominating and corporate governance committee. We have adopted a charter for each of the three committees. Each committee&#146;s
	members and functions are described below.
</FONT>
</P>
<P STYLE="MARGIN-TOP:18PX;MARGIN-BOTTOM:0PX">
<FONT STYLE="FONT-FAMILY:TIMES NEW ROMAN" SIZE="2">
<B>
<I>
	Audit Committee
</I>
</B>
</FONT>
</P>
<P STYLE="MARGIN-TOP:6PX;MARGIN-BOTTOM:0PX">
<FONT STYLE="FONT-FAMILY:TIMES NEW ROMAN" SIZE="2">
	Our audit committee consists of Messrs. William John Sharp, Xiandai Zhang and Yichun Zhang. Mr.&nbsp;Sharp is the chairman of our audit committee and meets the criteria of an audit committee financial
	expert as set forth under the applicable rules of the SEC. Our board of directors has determined that Messrs. Sharp, Zhang and Zhang are &#147;independent directors&#148; within the meaning of Section&nbsp;303A of the New York Stock Exchange Listed
	Company Manual, or NYSE Listed Company Manual, and meet the criteria for independence set forth in Section&nbsp;10A(m)(3) of the Exchange Act. The audit committee oversees our accounting and financial reporting processes and the audits of the
	financial statements of our company. The audit committee is responsible for, among other things:
</FONT>
</P>
<P STYLE="FONT-SIZE:6PX;MARGIN-TOP:0PX;MARGIN-BOTTOM:0PX">
	&nbsp;
</P>
<TABLE STYLE="BORDER-COLLAPSE:COLLAPSE" BORDER="0" CELLPADDING="0" CELLSPACING="0" WIDTH="100%">
<TR>
<TD WIDTH="3%" VALIGN="TOP" ALIGN="LEFT">
<FONT STYLE="FONT-FAMILY:TIMES NEW ROMAN" SIZE="2">
	&#149;
</FONT>
</TD>
<TD WIDTH="1%" VALIGN="TOP">
<FONT SIZE="1">
	&nbsp;
</FONT>
</TD>
<TD ALIGN="LEFT" VALIGN="TOP">
<P ALIGN="LEFT">
<FONT STYLE="FONT-FAMILY:TIMES NEW ROMAN" SIZE="2">
	selecting our independent registered public accounting firm and pre-approving all auditing and non-auditing services permitted to be performed by our
	independent registered public accounting firm;
</FONT>
</P>
</TD>
</TR>
</TABLE>
<P STYLE="FONT-SIZE:6PX;MARGIN-TOP:0PX;MARGIN-BOTTOM:0PX">
	&nbsp;
</P>
<TABLE STYLE="BORDER-COLLAPSE:COLLAPSE" BORDER="0" CELLPADDING="0" CELLSPACING="0" WIDTH="100%">
<TR>
<TD WIDTH="3%" VALIGN="TOP" ALIGN="LEFT">
<FONT STYLE="FONT-FAMILY:TIMES NEW ROMAN" SIZE="2">
	&#149;
</FONT>
</TD>
<TD WIDTH="1%" VALIGN="TOP">
<FONT SIZE="1">
	&nbsp;
</FONT>
</TD>
<TD ALIGN="LEFT" VALIGN="TOP">
<P ALIGN="LEFT">
<FONT STYLE="FONT-FAMILY:TIMES NEW ROMAN" SIZE="2">
	reviewing with our independent registered public accounting firm any audit issues or difficulties and management&#146;s response;
</FONT>
</P>
</TD>
</TR>
</TABLE>
<P STYLE="FONT-SIZE:6PX;MARGIN-TOP:0PX;MARGIN-BOTTOM:0PX">
	&nbsp;
</P>
<TABLE STYLE="BORDER-COLLAPSE:COLLAPSE" BORDER="0" CELLPADDING="0" CELLSPACING="0" WIDTH="100%">
<TR>
<TD WIDTH="3%" VALIGN="TOP" ALIGN="LEFT">
<FONT STYLE="FONT-FAMILY:TIMES NEW ROMAN" SIZE="2">
	&#149;
</FONT>
</TD>
<TD WIDTH="1%" VALIGN="TOP">
<FONT SIZE="1">
	&nbsp;
</FONT>
</TD>
<TD ALIGN="LEFT" VALIGN="TOP">
<P ALIGN="LEFT">
<FONT STYLE="FONT-FAMILY:TIMES NEW ROMAN" SIZE="2">
	reviewing and approving all proposed related-party transactions, as defined in Item&nbsp;404 of Regulation S-K under the Securities Act;
</FONT>
</P>
</TD>
</TR>
</TABLE>
<P STYLE="FONT-SIZE:6PX;MARGIN-TOP:0PX;MARGIN-BOTTOM:0PX">
	&nbsp;
</P>
<TABLE STYLE="BORDER-COLLAPSE:COLLAPSE" BORDER="0" CELLPADDING="0" CELLSPACING="0" WIDTH="100%">

	discussing the annual audited financial statements with management and our independent registered public accounting firm;
</FONT>
</P>
</TD>
</TR>
</TABLE>
<P STYLE="MARGIN-TOP:0PX;MARGIN-BOTTOM:0PX">

	meeting separately and periodically with management, our internal auditor and independent registered public accounting firm.

<P STYLE="MARGIN-TOP:18PX;MARGIN-BOTTOM:0PX">
<FONT STYLE="FONT-FAMILY:TIMES NEW ROMAN" SIZE="2">
<B>
<I>
	Compensation Committee
</I>
</B>
</FONT>
</P>
<P STYLE="MARGIN-TOP:6PX;MARGIN-BOTTOM:0PX">
<FONT STYLE="FONT-FAMILY:TIMES NEW ROMAN" SIZE="2">
	Our compensation committee consists of Messrs. Yichun Zhang, Jianhui Lai and William John Sharp, and is chaired by Mr.&nbsp;Zhang. Our board of directors has determined that each of Messrs. Zhang and
	Sharp of the compensation committee is an &#147;independent director&#148; within the meaning of Section&nbsp;303A of the NYSE Listed Company Manual. Our compensation committee assists the board in reviewing and approving the compensation structure
	of our directors and executive officers, including all forms of compensation to be provided to our directors and executive officers. Members of the compensation committee are not prohibited from direct involvement in determining their own
	compensation. Our chief executive officer may not be present at any committee meeting during which his compensation is deliberated. The compensation committee is responsible for, among other things:
</FONT>
</P>
<P STYLE="FONT-SIZE:6PX;MARGIN-TOP:0PX;MARGIN-BOTTOM:0PX">
	&nbsp;
</P>
<TABLE STYLE="BORDER-COLLAPSE:COLLAPSE" BORDER="0" CELLPADDING="0" CELLSPACING="0" WIDTH="100%">
<TR>
<TD WIDTH="3%" VALIGN="TOP" ALIGN="LEFT">
<FONT STYLE="FONT-FAMILY:TIMES NEW ROMAN" SIZE="2">
	&#149;
</FONT>
</TD>
<TD WIDTH="1%" VALIGN="TOP">
<FONT SIZE="1">
	&nbsp;
</FONT>
</TD>
<TD ALIGN="LEFT" VALIGN="TOP">
<P ALIGN="LEFT">
<FONT STYLE="FONT-FAMILY:TIMES NEW ROMAN" SIZE="2">
	approving and overseeing the compensation package for our executive officers;
</FONT>
</P>
</TD>
</TR>
</TABLE>
<P STYLE="FONT-SIZE:6PX;MARGIN-TOP:0PX;MARGIN-BOTTOM:0PX">
	&nbsp;
</P>
<TABLE STYLE="BORDER-COLLAPSE:COLLAPSE" BORDER="0" CELLPADDING="0" CELLSPACING="0" WIDTH="100%">

	&#149;
</FONT>
</TD>
<TD WIDTH="1%" VALIGN="TOP">
<FONT SIZE="1">
	&nbsp;
</FONT>
</TD>
<TD ALIGN="LEFT" VALIGN="TOP">
<P ALIGN="LEFT">
<FONT STYLE="FONT-FAMILY:TIMES NEW ROMAN" SIZE="2">
	reviewing and making recommendations to the board with respect to our compensation policies and the compensation of our directors; and
</FONT>
</P>
</TD>
</TR>
</TABLE>
<P STYLE="FONT-SIZE:6PX;MARGIN-TOP:0PX;MARGIN-BOTTOM:0PX">
	&nbsp;

<TD ALIGN="LEFT" VALIGN="TOP">
<P ALIGN="LEFT">
<FONT STYLE="FONT-FAMILY:TIMES NEW ROMAN" SIZE="2">
	reviewing periodically and making recommendations to the board regarding any long-term incentive compensation or equity plans, programs or similar
	arrangements, annual bonuses, employee pension and welfare benefit plans.
</FONT>
</P>
</TD>
</TR>
</TABLE>
<P STYLE="MARGIN-TOP:18PX;MARGIN-BOTTOM:0PX">
<FONT STYLE="FONT-FAMILY:TIMES NEW ROMAN" SIZE="2">
<B>
<I>
	Nominating and Corporate Governance
	Committee
</I>
</B>
</FONT>
</P>
<P STYLE="MARGIN-TOP:6PX;MARGIN-BOTTOM:0PX">
<FONT STYLE="FONT-FAMILY:TIMES NEW ROMAN" SIZE="2">
	Our nominating and corporate governance committee consists of Messrs. Jianhui Lai, Junqiu Gao and William John Sharp, and is
	chaired by Mr.&nbsp;Lai. Our board of directors has determined that Mr.&nbsp;Sharp of the nominating and corporate governance committee is an &#147;independent director&#148; within the meaning of Section&nbsp;303A of the NYSE Listed Company Manual.
	The nominating and corporate governance committee assists the board of directors in identifying individuals qualified to become our directors and in determining the composition of the board and its committees. The nominating and corporate governance
	committee is responsible for, among other things:
</FONT>
</P>
<P STYLE="FONT-SIZE:6PX;MARGIN-TOP:0PX;MARGIN-BOTTOM:0PX">
	&nbsp;
</P>
<TABLE STYLE="BORDER-COLLAPSE:COLLAPSE" BORDER="0" CELLPADDING="0" CELLSPACING="0" WIDTH="100%">
<TR>
<TD WIDTH="3%" VALIGN="TOP" ALIGN="LEFT">
<FONT STYLE="FONT-FAMILY:TIMES NEW ROMAN" SIZE="2">
	&#149;
</FONT>
</TD>
<TD WIDTH="1%" VALIGN="TOP">
<FONT SIZE="1">
	&nbsp;
</FONT>
</TD>
<TD ALIGN="LEFT" VALIGN="TOP">
<P ALIGN="LEFT">
<FONT STYLE="FONT-FAMILY:TIMES NEW ROMAN" SIZE="2">
	identifying and recommending to the board nominees for election or re-election to the board, or for appointment to fill any vacancy of the board;
</FONT>
</P>
</TD>
</TR>
</TABLE>
<P STYLE="FONT-SIZE:6PX;MARGIN-TOP:0PX;MARGIN-BOTTOM:0PX">
	&nbsp;
</P>
<TABLE STYLE="BORDER-COLLAPSE:COLLAPSE" BORDER="0" CELLPADDING="0" CELLSPACING="0" WIDTH="100%">
<TR>
<TD WIDTH="3%" VALIGN="TOP" ALIGN="LEFT">
<FONT STYLE="FONT-FAMILY:TIMES NEW ROMAN" SIZE="2">
	&#149;
</FONT>
</TD>
<TD WIDTH="1%" VALIGN="TOP">
<FONT SIZE="1">
	&nbsp;
</FONT>
</TD>
<TD ALIGN="LEFT" VALIGN="TOP">
<P ALIGN="LEFT">
<FONT STYLE="FONT-FAMILY:TIMES NEW ROMAN" SIZE="2">
	reviewing annually with the board the current composition of the board in light of the characteristics of independence, age, skills, experience and
	availability of service to us;
</FONT>
</P>
</TD>
</TR>
</TABLE>
<P STYLE="FONT-SIZE:6PX;MARGIN-TOP:0PX;MARGIN-BOTTOM:0PX">
	&nbsp;
</P>
<TABLE STYLE="BORDER-COLLAPSE:COLLAPSE" BORDER="0" CELLPADDING="0" CELLSPACING="0" WIDTH="100%">
<TR>
<TD WIDTH="3%" VALIGN="TOP" ALIGN="LEFT">
<FONT STYLE="FONT-FAMILY:TIMES NEW ROMAN" SIZE="2">
	&#149;
</FONT>
</TD>
<TD WIDTH="1%" VALIGN="TOP">
<FONT SIZE="1">
	&nbsp;
</FONT>
</TD>
<TD ALIGN="LEFT" VALIGN="TOP">
<P ALIGN="LEFT">
<FONT STYLE="FONT-FAMILY:TIMES NEW ROMAN" SIZE="2">
	advising the board periodically with respect to significant developments in the law and practice of corporate governance as well as our compliance with
	applicable laws and regulations, and making recommendations to the board on all matters of corporate governance and on any corrective action to be taken; and
</FONT>
</P>
</TD>
</TR>
</TABLE>
<P STYLE="FONT-SIZE:6PX;MARGIN-TOP:0PX;MARGIN-BOTTOM:0PX">
	&nbsp;
</P>
<TABLE STYLE="BORDER-COLLAPSE:COLLAPSE" BORDER="0" CELLPADDING="0" CELLSPACING="0" WIDTH="100%">

	&#149;

	&nbsp;
</FONT>
</TD>
<TD ALIGN="LEFT" VALIGN="TOP">
<P ALIGN="LEFT">
<FONT STYLE="FONT-FAMILY:TIMES NEW ROMAN" SIZE="2">
	monitoring compliance with our code of business conduct and ethics, including reviewing the adequacy and effectiveness of our procedures to ensure
	proper compliance.
</FONT>
</P>
</TD>
</TR>
</TABLE>
<P STYLE="MARGIN-TOP:18PX;MARGIN-BOTTOM:0PX">
<FONT STYLE="FONT-FAMILY:TIMES NEW ROMAN" SIZE="2">
<B>
	Interested Transactions
</B>
</FONT>
</P>
<P STYLE="MARGIN-TOP:6PX;MARGIN-BOTTOM:0PX">
<FONT STYLE="FONT-FAMILY:TIMES NEW ROMAN" SIZE="2">
	A director may vote with respect to any contract or transaction in which he is interested, provided that the nature of the interest of any directors in such contract or transaction is disclosed by him at
	or prior to the board&#146;s consideration and vote on such contract or transaction.
</FONT>
</P>
<P STYLE="MARGIN-TOP:18PX;MARGIN-BOTTOM:0PX">
<FONT STYLE="FONT-FAMILY:TIMES NEW ROMAN" SIZE="2">
<B>
	Remuneration and Borrowing
</B>
</FONT>
</P>
<P STYLE="MARGIN-TOP:6PX;MARGIN-BOTTOM:0PX">
<FONT STYLE="FONT-FAMILY:TIMES NEW ROMAN" SIZE="2">
	The directors may determine remuneration to be paid to the directors. The compensation committee assists the directors in reviewing and approving the
	compensation structure for the directors. The directors may exercise all the powers of the company to borrow money and to mortgage or charge its undertaking, property and uncalled capital, and to issue debentures or other securities whether outright
	or as security for any debt obligations of our company or of any third party.
</FONT>
</P>
<P STYLE="MARGIN-TOP:0PX;MARGIN-BOTTOM:0PX">
<FONT SIZE="1">
	&nbsp;
</FONT>
</P>
<P STYLE="MARGIN-TOP:0PX;MARGIN-BOTTOM:0PX" ALIGN="CENTER">
<FONT STYLE="FONT-FAMILY:TIMES NEW ROMAN" SIZE="2">
	76
</FONT>
</P>

</EFX_UNIDENTIFIED_TABLE>
<P STYLE="MARGIN-TOP:12PX;MARGIN-BOTTOM:0PX">
<FONT STYLE="FONT-FAMILY:TIMES NEW ROMAN" SIZE="2">
	All of our employees are stationed in the PRC. We do not have any part-time employees.
</FONT>
</P>
<P STYLE="MARGIN-TOP:12PX;MARGIN-BOTTOM:0PX">
<FONT STYLE="FONT-FAMILY:TIMES NEW ROMAN" SIZE="2">
	In compliance with the relevant PRC labor laws, we enter into individual employment contracts with our employees typically covering matters such as
	wages, bonuses, employee benefits, workplace safety, confidentiality obligations and non-competition (for our executive officers and employees involved in technology and research and development), and grounds for termination. In addition, we provide
	various healthcare benefits and insurance to our employees and participate in various employee benefit plans in accordance with applicable laws and regulations. These employment contracts generally have a term of three years. The total amount of
	contributions we made to employee benefit plans in 2013, 2014 and 2015 was RMB51.1 million, RMB55.0 million and RMB52.5 million (US$8.1 million), respectively. We invest in continuing education and training programs for our management staff and
	other employees to upgrade their skills and knowledge continuously. We provide our employees with internal training in various areas.
</FONT>
</P>
<P STYLE="MARGIN-TOP:12PX;MARGIN-BOTTOM:0PX">
<FONT STYLE="FONT-FAMILY:TIMES NEW ROMAN" SIZE="2">
	We have
	a labor union that protect employees&#146; rights, help fulfill our economic objectives, encourage employee participation in management decisions and assist in mediating disputes between us and union members. To date, we have not experienced any
	strikes, labor disputes or industrial action which had a material effect on our business, and consider our relations with our employees to be good.
</FONT>
</P>
<P STYLE="FONT-SIZE:18PX;MARGIN-TOP:0PX;MARGIN-BOTTOM:0PX">
	&nbsp;
</P>

<FONT STYLE="FONT-FAMILY:TIMES NEW ROMAN" SIZE="2">
<B>
	E.
</B>
</FONT>
</TD>

</TABLE>

<FONT STYLE="FONT-FAMILY:TIMES NEW ROMAN" SIZE="2">
	The following table sets
	forth information with respect to the beneficial ownership, within the meaning of Rule 13d-3 under the Exchange Act, of our ordinary shares as of March&nbsp;31, 2016 (unless otherwise indicated) by:
</FONT>
</P>

	&nbsp;

	each of our directors and executive officers; and
</FONT>

	&nbsp;

</FONT>

</TABLE>
<P STYLE="MARGIN-TOP:12PX;MARGIN-BOTTOM:0PX">
<FONT STYLE="FONT-FAMILY:TIMES NEW ROMAN" SIZE="2">
	Beneficial ownership is determined in accordance with rules and regulations of the SEC and includes voting or investment power with respect to the
	ordinary shares. Except as indicated below, and subject to applicable community property laws, the persons named in the table have sole voting and investment power with respect to all ordinary shares shown as beneficially owned by them. In computing
	the number of shares beneficially owned by a person or the percentage ownership of that person, we have included shares that the person has the right to acquire within 60 days of March&nbsp;31, 2016, including through the exercise of any option,
	warrant or other right or the conversion of any other security. These shares, however, are not included in the computation of the percentage ownership of any other person.
</FONT>
</P>

<FONT STYLE="FONT-FAMILY:TIMES NEW ROMAN" SIZE="2">
<B>
	Restricted Shares Granted to Mr.&nbsp;Yifan Li by Newrace Limited
</B>
</FONT>
</P>
<P STYLE="MARGIN-TOP:6PX;MARGIN-BOTTOM:0PX">
<FONT STYLE="FONT-FAMILY:TIMES NEW ROMAN" SIZE="2">
	Pursuant to a letter agreement for grant of restricted shares between Newrace Limited and Mr.&nbsp;Yifan Li, our former chief financial officer, dated
	December&nbsp;17, 2010, Mr.&nbsp;Li was granted 516,000 ordinary shares, representing 0.25% of our ordinary shares outstanding immediately after the completion of our initial public offering, beneficially owned by Newrace Limited in consideration
	for his serving as our chief financial officer. Of these restricted shares, 35.0%, 25.0% and 20.0% vested on the date our initial public offering was completed, on December&nbsp;31, 2011 and on December&nbsp;31, 2012, respectively, and 20.0% vested
	on December&nbsp;31, 2013.
</FONT>
</P>
